events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th, involving rear-end damage to their vehicle. They urgently requested claim initiation.
Upon review, the claim was categorised under auto accident due to the nature of the reported vehicle collision on the policyholder’s car.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and will coordinate the next steps with the policyholder.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment to the policyholder confirming receipt of the claim for the auto accident.
The agent requested detailed photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and witness statements to proceed with claim investigation.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents including photos, police report, and contact details of the witnesses involved in the incident.
Insurance claim investigation commenced by the assigned agent to verify the details and extent of the collision damage.
The investigation concluded confirming the damage was consistent with the reported collision and no conflicting claims were found.
A settlement offer was proposed to the policyholder, covering the repair costs estimated for the damaged vehicle parts.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the efficient communication throughout the claim process.
The insurance claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the policyholder.
An approved payment was issued to the policyholder’s bank account to cover the approved vehicle repair expenses after the accident.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that the payment was received and repairs were underway.
All documentation and communications related to the vehicle accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
